title: US Census 2024 State Boundaries with H3 Indexing
description: 2024 state and territory boundaries from the US Census Bureau's TIGER/Line shapefiles, processed into cloud-native formats with H3 hexagonal spatial indexing at resolution 10 (~0.015 km² per hex). Includes all 50 states, District of Columbia, and 5 territories (Puerto Rico, American Samoa, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, U.S. Virgin Islands). Data includes geographic identifiers, names, land/water areas, and internal point coordinates.
license_other: Public Domain (U.S. Government Work) - Not subject to copyright protection within the United States (17 U.S.C. § 105).

links.title: Detailed Data Documentation and Usage Examples

geoparquet.title: GeoParquet file with all 56 state/territory boundaries
geoparquet.description: Cloud-native GeoParquet format optimized for analytical queries. Use with DuckDB, Polars, pandas, or any GeoParquet-compatible tool. Geometries in EPSG:4326 (WGS84).

pmtiles.title: PMTiles for web mapping
pmtiles.description: Pyramid of map tiles in PMTiles format for efficient web map rendering with MapLibre GL JS or Leaflet.

h3-parquet.title: H3 hex-indexed parquet files
h3-parquet.description: Parquet files partitioned by H3 resolution 0 cells. Each row contains a state with its intersecting H3 cell at resolution 10 (~0.015 km²). Includes parent resolutions 9, 8, and 0 for hierarchical analysis.

table:columns.name: _cng_fid
table:columns.description: Cloud-native geometry feature ID. Unique identifier for each state/territory. Use this for joining between GeoParquet and H3 hex formats.

table:columns.name: DIVISION
table:columns.description: Census division code (1-digit): Subdivisions of the four census regions (e.g., 1=New England, 2=Middle Atlantic, 3=East North Central, etc.).

table:columns.name: STATEFP
table:columns.description: State FIPS code (2 digits). Federal Information Processing Standard code uniquely identifying each state and territory (e.g., '06' for California, '72' for Puerto Rico).

table:columns.name: STATENS
table:columns.description: State GNIS identifier (8 digits). Geographic Names Information System feature identifier for the state/territory.

table:columns.name: GEOID
table:columns.description: Geographic identifier. Complete unique identifier for the state/territory, same as STATEFP for states.

table:columns.name: GEOIDFQ
table:columns.description: Fully qualified geographic identifier. Complete hierarchical identifier including nation code prefix.

table:columns.name: STUSPS
table:columns.description: Two-letter state postal abbreviation (e.g., 'CA' for California, 'NY' for New York). Used by US Postal Service.

table:columns.name: LSAD
table:columns.description: Legal/Statistical Area Description code. Identifies the type of entity (e.g., '00' for state, '10' for Commonwealth).

table:columns.name: MTFCC
table:columns.description: MAF/TIGER Feature Class Code. Five-character code classifying geographic features (e.g., 'G4000' for state/territory).

table:columns.name: FUNCSTAT
table:columns.description: Functional status code. Indicates the current functioning status of the entity: A=Active, N=Nonfunctioning, F=Fictitious.

table:columns.name: ALAND
table:columns.description: Land area in square meters. Total land area of the state/territory as calculated from Census boundaries.

table:columns.name: AWATER
table:columns.description: Water area in square meters. Total inland, coastal, Great Lakes, and territorial water area.

table:columns.name: INTPTLAT
table:columns.description: Internal point latitude. Latitude of a point inside the state/territory (decimal degrees).

table:columns.name: INTPTLON
table:columns.description: Internal point longitude. Longitude of a point inside the state/territory (decimal degrees).

table:columns.name: geom
table:columns.description: Geometry column containing the multipolygon boundary in WKB (Well-Known Binary) format, EPSG:4326 (WGS84).

table:columns.name: bbox
table:columns.description: Bounding box of the feature containing xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax coordinates in EPSG:4326.
